intro: Scleranthus stenoloma, commonly known as narrowleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy surface, while its flowers are small and greenish-white in color. Scleranthus stenoloma is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
